subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han simp|曑|f=晶|t=厽}}.

The bronze script form is an {{Han compound|晶|光|彡|ls=ic|nocap=1|t1=stars|t2=light; brightness|t3=light rays}} – {{w|Three Stars (Chinese constellation)|Three Stars}} mansion. {{och-l|彡}} also acts as a phonetic component. Ignoring the lines connecting the three stars, {{zh-l|*光}} may be interpreted as {{zh-l|*卩|kneeling person}}, representing someone looking at the shining stars above him.

Alternatively, it may be the original character of {{och-l|簪|hairpin}}, since the bronze script forms resemble a person wearing a hat with three stars.

Based on the seal script form, ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' interprets the character as a {{Han compound|晶|㐱|ls=psc|nocap=1|c1=s|c2=p|t1=stars}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|s=参|alt=曑,叄,㕘,叅}}
From {{och-l|三|[[three]]}} + other element ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
